channel.title: Comments on: 2 Degrees of Academic Separation using Google Scholar v1
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: Steven A. Cholewiak
item.dc:creator: Steven A. Cholewiak
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/06/19/2-degrees-of-academic-separation-using-google-scholar-v1/#comment-47864">sisi</a>.
I usually jump from resource to resource and like to use examples to fuel my understanding, so unfortunately all I can suggest is to look at the documentation provided and find some examples that might interest and guide you. For example, <a href="http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock" rel="nofollow">mbostock</a> has a great set of examples.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to sisi.

I usually jump from resource to resource and like to use examples to fuel my understanding, so unfortunately all I can suggest is to look at the documentation provided and find some examples that might interest and guide you. For example, mbostock has a great set of examples.

item.title: By: sisi
item.dc:creator: sisi
item.description: Hi, Steve! How have you been? Nice post! It's interesting that I just thought about starting to learn D3 yesterday. Do you have some good resources you can recommend?
item.content:encoded: Hi, Steve! How have you been? Nice post! It’s interesting that I just thought about starting to learn D3 yesterday. Do you have some good resources you can recommend?
